item.title: By: Jodi Schneider
item.dc:creator: Jodi Schneider
item.description: Did you see the <a href="http://quantifiedself.com/2011/11/trust-your-results-afternoon-sessions-on-food-and-health/#comment-3681" rel="nofollow">comments section for Chia's summary post</a>? Looks like Omega 3 profiles between grassfed and grainfed cows differ--so blaming Irish cows (or their diets) might actually not be far off!
item.content:encoded: Did you see the comments section for Chia’s summary post? Looks like Omega 3 profiles between grassfed and grainfed cows differ–so blaming Irish cows (or their diets) might actually not be far off!

item.title: By: Jodi Schneider
item.dc:creator: Jodi Schneider
item.description:
"How­ever I spoke with a lot of people this week­end (many of them wear­ing track­ing devices like fit­bit & jawbone) who men­tioned that when they talk about using Run­Keeper or a With­ings scale, the response is often “Wow cool, I want to do that too!”"
It matters where you live. So many of these folks were from the Bay Area. Consider the demographic!
item.content:encoded:
“How­ever I spoke with a lot of people this week­end (many of them wear­ing track­ing devices like fit­bit & jawbone) who men­tioned that when they talk about using Run­Keeper or a With­ings scale, the response is often “Wow cool, I want to do that too!””

It matters where you live. So many of these folks were from the Bay Area. Consider the demographic!

item.title: By: What I Learned from QS Europe | Quantified Self
item.dc:creator: What I Learned from QS Europe | Quantified Self

item.title: By: James Gallagher
item.dc:creator: James Gallagher
item.description: Hey Martha, that's very cool to read and I love the idea. I've wanted to do more of this myself but so far do nothing more than track my bicycle commutes. I have an interest in monitoring my mood and perhaps relating it to food but never really found the right tool yet. Self knowledge is a wonderful thing.
item.content:encoded: Hey Martha, that’s very cool to read and I love the idea. I’ve wanted to do more of this myself but so far do nothing more than track my bicycle commutes. I have an interest in monitoring my mood and perhaps relating it to food but never really found the right tool yet. Self knowledge is a wonderful thing.
